disrupt.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems
disrupt.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
disrupt.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to prevent a situation, event, system etc from working in the normal way
disrupt.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Traders are worried that war would disrupt ocean shipping.
The union have threatened to disrupt services if their members are not happy with the pay award.
